intro: Pavetta reinwardtii var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy but become smooth in this variety. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
